contents: To research the possibility of brain injury, scientists at the Albert Einstein College of Medicine in New York City, studied the brains of 31 amateur soccer players, all of whom had played soccer for an average of 22 years. Researchers used diffusion tensor imaging (DTI), an advanced form of magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) that allows scientists to analyze microscopic changes in the brain’s white matter. After the DTI was performed, participants were given a series of cognitive tests to measure memory and brain function.
